benchmark_config.jira_title: Implement/Test API: GET /1.0/kb/accounts/{accountId}/tags - Retrieve account tags

covered: Valid Request: Happy path covered (TC01) verifying 200 + application/json + Tag array and default audit=NONE.
Empty Response: TC06 covers account with no tags returning an empty JSON array.
Query Parameters: includedDeleted (TC02, TC05), audit=FULL (TC03, TC05), audit=MINIMAL (TC04), invalid audit value (TC09), and unknown extra params (TC10) are tested.
Path parameter validation: multiple edge/error cases covered (invalid format TC08, partial UUID TC20, empty TC21, whitespace TC22, max length boundary TC23).
Error scenarios: non-existent account 404 (TC07), invalid accountId 400 (TC08/others), downstream failures 502/503 (TC24/TC11) are present.
Authorization: missing and invalid auth tokens are tested (TC12, TC13) returning 401.
Security/Input validation: injection (TC14) and XSS (TC15) attempts tested and expected to fail.
Performance/scale: large payload (10,000 tags) performance (TC16) and concurrent requests (TC17) are included.
Regression & compatibility: regression test for deleted-tags bug (TC18) and legacy client compatibility (TC19) exist.
Integration/data consistency: TC25 ensures integrated-system updates are reflected.
gaps: Pagination: No scenarios validate pagination behavior or limits (offset/limit/page tokens) for large result sets — only a single large-set performance test exists (TC16).
Caching Behavior / Headers: No tests validate caching headers (ETag, Cache-Control, Last-Modified) or conditional GET handling (304 responses).
Rate Limiting / Throttling: No explicit rate-limit or throttling tests (e.g., many rapid requests to trigger 429). TC17 covers concurrency but not rate limit enforcement.
Authorization scope/roles (403): Tests cover 401 (unauthenticated) but not authorization failures (403) for insufficient permissions or role-based access.
Consistent header validation: Content-Type and other response headers are asserted only in TC01; not verified across other scenarios (including error responses).
Schema-level validation of Tag objects: Tests assert "Tag objects" are returned but do not validate Tag object fields, types, required fields, or response schema strictly.
Negative combinations of query parameters: No tests for includedDeleted=false explicitly combined with audit variations (ensure defaults), or boundary boolean values (includedDeleted=false explicit).
Pagination + performance: No tests that combine pagination with performance (e.g., paged responses for very large tag sets).
recommendations: Add pagination tests: verify offset/limit/page behavior, boundaries, maximum page sizes, and expected metadata (if any). Include a test for retrieving a middle page and last page.

Add caching/conditional GET tests: verify presence and correctness of ETag, Cache-Control, Last-Modified headers; test conditional requests (If-None-Match / If-Modified-Since) leading to 304 responses where appropriate.
Add rate-limiting tests: hammer the endpoint to assert 429 responses when quotas are exceeded and validate Retry-After header semantics.
Add authorization-scope tests: include scenarios where an authenticated user lacks permission and should receive 403, and tests for role-based access control if applicable.

Add strict schema validation for Tag objects across success cases: validate required fields, field types (e.g., tagId, tagDefinitionId, objectType, audit info structure), and that deleted flag or audit details are present/absent per query parameters.
Extend header assertions across scenarios: ensure Content-Type, charset, and error response formats are consistent for success and error cases.
Add tests for query parameter boundary/combinational cases: explicitly test includedDeleted=false, audit omitted vs audit=NONE, and combinations to verify defaulting behavior.
Combine pagination with performance tests: ensure acceptable response times when paging through very large tag lists and confirm server behaves consistently across pages.
